SEARCH
Package org.fluentjdbc

Class DatabaseStatement

java.lang.Object
org.fluentjdbc.DatabaseStatement
@ParametersAreNonnullByDefault public class DatabaseStatement extends Object
Allows the execution of arbitrary SQL statements with parameters and returns the ResultSet. Will convert parameters to the statement using bindParameter(PreparedStatement, int, Object), which supports many more data types than JDBC supports natively. Returns the result via list(Connection, DatabaseResult.RowMapper), singleObject(Connection, DatabaseResult.RowMapper) and stream(Connection, DatabaseResult.RowMapper), which uses DatabaseRow to convert ResultSet types.

    • bindParameter

      public static void bindParameter(PreparedStatement stmt, int index, @Nullable Object parameter) throws SQLException
      Calls the correct PreparedStatement setXXX method based on the type of the parameter. Supports Instant, ZonedDateTime, OffsetDateTime, LocalDate, String, List of String or Integer, Enum, UUID, Double
      Throws:
      SQLException

    • toDatabaseType

      public static Object toDatabaseType(@Nullable Object parameter, Connection connection)
      Converts parameter to canonical database type. Supports Instant, ZonedDateTime, OffsetDateTime, LocalDate, String, Enum, UUID, Double

    • addBatch

      public static <T> void addBatch(PreparedStatement statement, Iterable<T> objects, Collection<Function<T,?>> columnValueExtractors) throws SQLException
      Binds the parameters and calls PreparedStatement.addBatch().
      Throws:
      SQLException
      See Also:
      • bindParameter(PreparedStatement, int, Object)

    • executeUpdate

      public int executeUpdate(Connection connection)
      Calls Connection.prepareStatement(String) with the statement, bindParameters(PreparedStatement, Collection), converting each parameter in the process and executes the statement

    • parameterString

      public static String parameterString(int parameterCount)
      Create a string like ?, ?, ? with the parameterCount number of '?'

    • dbValuesAreEqual

      public static boolean dbValuesAreEqual(Object value, DatabaseRow row, String field, Connection connection) throws SQLException
      Returns true if the object value equals the specified field name in the database. Converts toDatabaseType(Object, Connection) to decrease number of false positives
      Throws:
      SQLException

    • singleObject

      public <T> SingleRow<T> singleObject(Connection connection, DatabaseResult.RowMapper<T> mapper)
      If the query returns no rows, returns SingleRow.absent(java.util.function.Supplier<EX>), if exactly one row is returned, maps it and return it, if more than one is returned, throws `IllegalStateException`
      Parameters:
      connection - Database connection
      mapper - Function object to map a single returned row to a object
      Returns:
      the mapped row if one row is returned, Optional.empty otherwise
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if more than one row was matched the the query

    • list

      public <OBJECT> List<OBJECT> list(Connection connection, DatabaseResult.RowMapper<OBJECT> mapper)
      Execute the query and map each return value over the DatabaseResult.RowMapper function to return a list. Example: 
           List<Instant> creationTimes = table.where("status", status).list(row -> row.getInstant("created_at"))

    • forEach

      public void forEach(Connection connection, DatabaseResult.RowConsumer consumer)
      Executes the SELECT * FROM ... statement and calls back to DatabaseResult.RowConsumer for each returned row

    • stream

      public <OBJECT> Stream<OBJECT> stream(Connection connection, DatabaseResult.RowMapper<OBJECT> mapper)
      Execute the query and map each return value over the DatabaseResult.RowMapper function to return a stream. Example: 
           table.where("status", status).stream(row -> row.getInstant("created_at"))

    • execute

      public <T> T execute(Connection connection, DatabaseStatement.PreparedStatementFunction<T> f)
      Calls Connection.prepareStatement(String) with the statement, bindParameters(PreparedStatement, Collection), converting each parameter in the process and executes the argument function with the statement

    • execute

      public <T> T execute(Connection connection, DatabaseStatement.PreparedStatementFunction<T> f, String[] columnNames)
      Calls Connection.prepareStatement(String, String[]) with the statement and columnNames, bindParameters(PreparedStatement, Collection), converting each parameter in the process and executes the argument function with the statement

    • query

      public <T> T query(Connection connection, DatabaseResult.DatabaseResultMapper<T> resultMapper)
